content: the nami beanie knitting pattern by kristie lau handmade by chris & kris https //www etsy com/ca/shop/handmadebychrisnkris instagram @handmadebychrisnkris email handmadebychrisnkris@gmail com 1 | p age introduction the word nami in japanese means wave this pattern consists of alternating cables and uses bulky weight yarn the nami beanie is a quick project and is perfect for someone who is new to knitting cables information skill level beginner skills required cast on cabling knit knit in the round knit two together knit three together purl materials and tools 5 3 oz / 90 yds of malabrigo rasta or similar weighted super bulky 6 yarn 8mm / us11 16 circular knitting needles 10mm / us15 16 circular knitting needles using a smaller left needle will make it easier to knit the ms stitch 10mm / us15 double pointed needle dpns or 10mm / us15 circular knitting needles with a longer cord for the magic loop method cable needle stitch marker scissors large tapestry needle gauge 10 stitches x 12 row on a 4 x4 stockinette swatch with 10mm / us15 needles finished measurements 8 wide by 8 5 long sizing fits a medium size 21 -22 5 adult head abbreviations co = cast on k = knit k2tog = knit two stitches together k3tog = knit three stitches together c3b = slip two stitches onto cable needle and leave at back of work knit one stitch from left needle then knit two stitches from cable needle c3f = slip one stitch onto cable needle and leave at front of work knit two stitches from left needle then knit one stitches from cable needle p = purl sm = stitch marker st s = stitch es * = repeat 2 | p age pattern note this pattern is worked in the round brim with 8mm / us11 16 needles co 48 sts place sm and join in the round rounds 1 7 *k1 p1* body change to 10mm / us15 16 needles round 1 *k3 p1* round 2 *k3 p1 c3b p1 * round 3 - 5 *k3 p1* round 6 *c3f p1 k3 p1* round 7 - 9 *k3 p1* round 10 - 17 repeat rounds 2 to 9 round 18 *k3 p1 c3b p1 * round 19 - 20 *k3 p1* decrease switch to dpn s or magic loop method when it becomes too tight to knit round 1 *k3tog p1 k3 p1* round 2 -3 *k1 p1 k3 p1* round 4 *k1 p1 k3tog p1* round 5 *k1 p1* round 6 *k2tog * finishing cut yarn leaving an 8 tail use a tapestry needle and weave yarn through remaining loops pull tightly and cinch top of hat to close weave in all ends 3 | p age disclosure the pattern and pictures within this document are property of handmade by chris & kris© all rights reserved it is illegal to redistribute sell or share this pattern in part whole electronically or physically finished beanies made using this pattern may be
